New Records: Pakistan broke the record for the highest ever run chase in a World Cup
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan's 134 helped Pakistan complete the record chase
Sri Lanka's batting struggled in the last 10 overs, adding only 61 runs for the loss of 5 wickets
Pre-Game Insights: Mickey Arthur hopes to use Sri Lanka knowledge against them
Naveed Nawaz wants his bowling unit to learn from the South Africa game and execute better against Pakistan
Post-Match Reflections: Theekshana said Sri Lanka's inexperienced bowlers are struggling to make an impact in these batting-friendly conditions
We left 20-25 runs out there with the bat: Shanaka
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wickets here in India are less forgiving: Theekshana
Pakistan would want their top three to return to form, and Sri Lankan bowlers would look to forget the South Africa game completely
Others: Babar Azam decided to play Shafique after watching his form in the nets
Shafique posted a superb 113 in his first ever World Cup match
